sentence: Then I will assess the crosscurrents shaping prospects going forward and the sustainability of recent economic performance and give my perspective on challenges facing monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Let me emphasize that the views about the economic outlook and about monetary policy I present here are my own and should not be interpreted as the position of the Board of Governors or the FOMC.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: First, there has been strong momentum in private domestic demand -- the sum of consumption, private fixed investment and residential construction -- only partially offset by a decline in net exports.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The result has been consistent above-trend growth and a rise in resource utilization rates, particularly in the labor market.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Second, the strength in the aggregate demand for goods and services has been encouraged by favorable financial conditions.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Whereas, normally, financial conditions become less favorable during an expansion and ultimately constrain demand, in this expansion financial conditions have become increasingly favorable and therefore have continued to support above-trend growth.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Third, a coincidence of favorable shocks has enabled businesses to produce at a lower cost; in the short run, at least, this restrains inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The result has been a slower increase in the CPI and other measures of the overall price level, even as the economy has raced ahead to higher utilization rates.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The favorable shocks have included a decline in oil prices, a decline in import prices associated with the cumulative appreciation in the dollar, technological innovations that have sped the reduction in computer prices, changes in medical care management that have held down the increase in benefit costs, and improved crops that have damped food prices.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: I have said many times that if I had a dime for every time I have had to say faster-than-expected growth and lower-than-expected inflation, I would be a rich man today!
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Growth over 1998 was nearly 4%, the highest annual growth in about a decade.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The unemployment rate declined by about 3/4 percentage point last year to a quarter-century low.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: And inflation declined to a more than 30-year low.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Monetary policy has helped deliver a low inflation environment and the strong economy and disciplined fiscal policy have delivered a balanced budget.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In the case of monetary policy, the low inflation environment is one we believe encourages efficient resource allocation and perhaps higher levels of saving and investment.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: In the case of fiscal policy, the government is no longer competing with the private sector for private saving, contributing to lower real interest rates and higher rates of capital formation.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Normally, this would result in rising inflation, but the favorable supply shocks have not only prevented a rise in inflation, but have allowed inflation to decline.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Monetary policy has accommodated the above-trend growth and rising utilization rates precisely because they have been accompanied by declining inflation.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The unemployment rate is below the consensus estimates of the threshold consistent with stable inflation, although there is somewhat greater than normal uncertainty about this estimate.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: This threshold is called NAIRU, the nonaccelerating inflation rate of unemployment.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: On the other hand, the measures of resource utilization in the product market, notably the capacity utilization rate in the manufacturing sector, do not suggest excess demand.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: There is, in fact, an unusual discrepancy between the unemployment and capacity utilization rates, compared to previous expansions; that is, the capacity utilization rate is lower than would have been expected, based on past experience, at the prevailing unemployment rate.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: This undoubtedly accounts for the perception of limited pricing leverage and has contributed to the restrained inflation, despite the low unemployment rate.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Nevertheless, the very tight labor markets can be expected to put upward pressure on wage change and hence inflation, once the special forces restraining inflation dissipate or reverse.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Second, there is some question about how to assess the degree of restraint or stimulus associated with current monetary policy.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Although the nominal federal funds rate has remained nearly constant, the decline in inflation has raised the real federal funds rate.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Many have observed the rise in the real federal funds rate to a level well above its historical average and concluded that monetary policy is currently restrictive.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The implication is that monetary policy is already well positioned to slow the expansion.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: On the other hand, many other measures of financial conditions appear to be indicating, to the contrary, that financial conditions are very favorable, highly supportive of contained momentum in aggregate demand and perhaps becoming even more so.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: This interpretation appears to be confirmed by the continued strength in aggregate demand in general and in interest-sensitive sectors in particular.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Real long-term interest rates, based on survey measures of inflation, have been stable to declining, equity prices have been soaring, credit availability has been more than ample, underwriting standards may have eased some, loan pricing is aggressive, spreads between safe and risky assets have narrowed, and the money supply is growing rapidly.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: I conclude that, notwithstanding the recent rise in the real federal funds rate, neither financial conditions in general nor monetary policy in particular are currently restraining aggregate demand.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Third, there has been a significant rebound in productivity growth over 1996 and 1997, compared to the previous two years.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The question that the data do not immediately reveal is whether this rebound was a normal cyclical rebound or marks a significant increase in trend productivity growth.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Each story carries with it an implication about the sustainability of recent performance and a challenge for monetary policy.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: This story emphasizes the role of good fortune in the current exceptional performance and highlights the potential that we may not be able to maintain the recent rate of growth and the current high labor utilization rates for much longer without ultimately suffering an increase in inflation.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The key to this story is the series of favorable supply shocks that have, in my judgment, masked, for a time, the normal consequences of very tight labor markets and permitted the economy to operate beyond the point of long-run sustainable capacity without the usual inflationary consequences.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The challenge facing monetary policy, in this interpretation, is to facilitate a transition to a more sustainable state before the favorable supply shocks dissipate or reverse.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: This story emphasizes the possibility that structural changes have permanently altered what the economy is capable of delivering in terms of both average growth and the unemployment rate consistent with stable inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In this interpretation, monetary policy must be careful not to interfere with the economy taking advantage of its improved potential.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: I have also raised my estimate of trend productivity -- from 1.1%, the average rate for the 20 years prior to the current expansion to 1.3% or 1.4%.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: A tenth of this increase in trend productivity growth reflects the technical revisions to the CPI which have lowered the chain measure of the GDP deflator by a tenth.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: This is not an increase in trend productivity in this expansion, relative to previous expansions, but rather an upward revision to productivity growth over the entire postwar period, the mirror image of a decline in the upward bias to measured inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: It should be noted, nevertheless, that the technical revisions to measured inflation do account for part of the appearance of improved economic performance.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: In addition, the data suggest to me, as to many private sector forecasters, that there might be a tenth or two increase in trend productivity, an improvement that is generally associated with capital deepening, an increase in the amount of equipment each worker has at its disposal, as a result of the strength of investment in this expansion.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: As such, this improvement in productivity growth may itself be transitory, part of a one-time increase in the level of productivity associated with a transition to a higher capital-to-labor ratio.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Nevertheless, even a couple of tenths improvement in productivity growth, if sustained for some period, would give an important boost to higher living standards over time.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: But this upward adjustment in my estimate of the productivity trend plays only a negligible role in explaining how we have managed such exceptional economic performance over the last couple of years.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The relative weights here are very important because they affect the challenge for monetary policy.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Challenges for Monetary Policy The challenge for monetary policy, as always, is to sustain the best possible economic performance.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: We aim for maximum sustainable growth and maximum sustainable levels of output and employment.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Trying to do more threatens to give back some of the reduction in inflation that has moved the U.S. to a position very close to the Federal Reserve's objective of price stability.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The bottom line is that it is essential that growth slow from the near 4% over 1997 to and perhaps below trend for a while to allow the economy to move toward a more sustainable state.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: First, there is a tug of war between the continued exceptional momentum in private domestic demand and the external drag from the Asian crisis.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Still, the sharper-than-expected decline in oil prices, the decline in long-term bond yields and the further rise in equity prices in recent months are providing some offset to the external drag coming from Asia and the appreciation of the dollar.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The question is when and how much of a slowing results, and whether the slowdown takes growth to or below trend, or leaves growth still above trend.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Second, there is a tug of war between the very tight labor market and the set of forces that have been restraining inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The forces restraining inflation have been winning this battle to date, and they have been reinforced this year by the sharper-than-expected decline in oil prices, by the even more extraordinary decline in computer prices in recent months, and by the decline in commodity prices and further downward pressure on import prices associated with the crisis in Asia.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: As the economy entered 1998, continued momentum in private domestic demand was clearly evident, while the drag from Asia was less obvious.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The March employment report was the strongest evidence to date that a slowing is under way, although it should be appreciated that there is often more noise than signal in one month's data.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: In terms of inflation, there is no evidence to date that wage pressures are building, relative to last year, and certainly no evidence of a pickup in inflation, though the recent data for core CPI has hinted that the earlier downward trend may now be behind us.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: At any rate, it appears likely, given the renewal of favorable supply shocks, that inflation will remain well contained this year.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: But monetary policy has little ability to affect inflation this year.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: We should, therefore, be focusing on inflation prospects for next year.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: As I noted earlier, some upward pressure on inflation is likely going forward as forces retraining inflation dissipate or reverse, though a similar statement would have been in order at this time last year.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The expected persistence of the special forces restraining inflation is therefore an important consideration in forecasting inflation and in assessing the appropriate course of monetary policy.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: It is important that, as the forces retraining inflation dissipate or reverse, that this upward pressure on inflation is not reinforced by inflationary pressures generated from very high utilization rates.
label: LABEL_2
